it.polimi.automata

Interface IBA<LABEL extends Label,STATE extends State,TRANSITION extends Transition<LABEL>>

  • Type Parameters:
    STATE - is the type of the state of the Buchi Automaton. The type of the states of the automaton must implement the interface State
    TRANSITION - is the type of the transition of the Buchi Automaton. The typer of the transitions of the automaton must implement the interface Transition
    LABEL - is the type of the label of the transitions depending on whether the automaton represents the model or the claim it is a set of proposition or a propositional logic formula Label
    All Superinterfaces:
    BA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION>, java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IBAImpl

    public interface IBA<LABEL extends Label,STATE extends State,TRANSITION extends Transition<LABEL>>
extends BA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION>

    Represents an Incomplete Buchi Automaton which extends a Buchi automaton with transparent states

    Author:
    claudiomenghi
    See Also:
    The state of the automaton must must implement the {@link State} interface
    The transition of the automaton must must implement the {@link Transition} interface
    The label of the transition must implement the label interface and depending on whether the automaton represents the model or the claim it is a set of proposition or a propositional logic formula

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTransparentState(STATE s)
      adds the transparent state s to the states of the IBA and to the set of the transparent state
      if the state is already transparent no action is performed
      if the state is a state of the BA but is not transparent, it is also added to the set of the transparent state
      IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> clone()
      creates a copy of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
      java.util.Set<STATE> getTransparentStates()
      returns the set of the transparent states of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
      boolean isTransparent(STATE s)
      check if the state is transparent
      IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> replace(STATE transparentState, IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> ibaToInject, java.util.Map<STATE,java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<TRANSITION,STATE>>> inComing, java.util.Map<STATE,java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<TRANSITION,STATE>>> outComing)
      returns a new Incomplete Buchi automaton where the transparent state is replaced by the ibaToInject the inComing and outComing transitions specifies how the initial and the accepting states are connected with the current Incomplete Buchi automaton
      If the transparent state to be replaced is also accepting, all the states of the ibaToInject become also accepting for the whole automaton
      Similarly, if the transparent state is also initial, all the initial states of the ibaToInject become initial for the whole automaton

      • Methods inherited from interface it.polimi.automata.BA

        addAcceptState, addCharacter, addInitialState, addState, addTransition, getAcceptStates, getAlphabet, getGraph, getInitialStates, getOutTransitions, getStates, getTransitionDestination, getTransitions, getTransitionSource, removeAcceptingState, removeInitialState, removeState, removeTransition

    • Method Detail

      • isTransparent

        boolean isTransparent(STATE s)
        check if the state is transparent
        Parameters:
        s - is the state to be checked if transparent
        Returns:
        true if the state s is transparent, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the state s is null or if the state is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton

      • getTransparentStates

        java.util.Set<STATE> getTransparentStates()
        returns the set of the transparent states of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
        Returns:
        the set of the transparent states of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton (if no transparent states are present an empty set is returned)

      • addTransparentState

        void addTransparentState(STATE s)
        adds the transparent state s to the states of the IBA and to the set of the transparent state
        if the state is already transparent no action is performed
        if the state is a state of the BA but is not transparent, it is also added to the set of the transparent state
        Parameters:
        s - the state to be added in the IBA
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state s is null

      • replace

        IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> replace(STATE transparentState,
                                  IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> ibaToInject,
                                  java.util.Map<STATE,java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<TRANSITION,STATE>>> inComing,
                                  java.util.Map<STATE,java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<TRANSITION,STATE>>> outComing)
        returns a new Incomplete Buchi automaton where the transparent state is replaced by the ibaToInject the inComing and outComing transitions specifies how the initial and the accepting states are connected with the current Incomplete Buchi automaton
        If the transparent state to be replaced is also accepting, all the states of the ibaToInject become also accepting for the whole automaton
        Similarly, if the transparent state is also initial, all the initial states of the ibaToInject become initial for the whole automaton
        Parameters:
        transparentState - is the transparent state to be replaced
        ibaToInject - is the Incomplete Buchi Automaton to be injected inside the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
        inComing - are the transitions that connect the refinement of the transparent state with the current incomplete Buchi Automaton
        outComing - are the transitions that connect the refinement of the transparent state with the current incomplete Buchi Automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the transparent state, the ibaToInject, the inComing or outComing transitions are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the transparentState is not transparent
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source of an incoming transition was not connected to the transparent state
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the state pointed by an incoming transition is not an initial state of the ibaToInject
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the destination of an out-coming transition was not connected to the transparent state
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source of an out-coming transition is not a final state of the ibaToInject
        See Also:
        clone()

      • clone

        IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION> clone()
        creates a copy of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
        Returns:
        a copy of the Incomplete Buchi Automaton
